group_works.title: Zoo animals of our story books

results.title: Zoo animals of our story books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Background for Social Studies”.
Designed to stimulate young children’s interest in reading stories about animals that can be seen in a zoo. These animals are compared with the character found in storybooks, such as tigers in “Little Black Sambo”, deer in “Bambi” and bears in “Goldilocks and the Three Bears”. The film concludes with an invitation to the children to make up their own story based on the character “Bubble the Elephant”.

results.title: The Ohio River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Background for Social Studies”.
Colonists floating down the Ohio River helped to settle the present cities of Pittsburgh, Cincinatti, Louisville, Huntington and Wheeling. Today the Ohio is America’s busiest inland waterway. Its enormous volume of water and nearby coalfields have attracted steel, chemical, aluminium and atomic energy plants, and efforts are being made to solve problems of water pollution, flood control and increasing traffic.

results.title: The Sentence of the court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
This docudrama looks at what the subsequent history might have been of the boys in the gang that attacked the conductor in the film the “Last Bus” (Title code 006006). Examines the factors which might have caused the boys behaviour, their likely punishment and its effect on them. Companion film to “Last Bus”.

results.title: Last bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A docudrama featuring a group of teenage boys who attack a bus conductor on a late night journey. None of the passengers go to the conductor’s aid. Afterwards the passengers try to justify their inactivity to an interviewer who tries to discover why the boys did it. See companion film “The Sentence of the court” (Title code 009645).

group_siblings.title: The Great zoos of the world, Frankfurt

results.title: The Great zoos of the world, Frankfurt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Scene”.
A tour of the Frankfurt Zoo, showing the influence Dr Bernhard Grzimek, the Director, has had on the kind of animals in the collection and they way in which they are displayed. Also looks at the question of having one man in sole charge of a zoo.

group_works.title: The Class
group_works.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Huw Wheldon and BBC-TV

results.title: East meets West
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Monitor”.
A musical encounter uniting European and Indian music in a session of improvisation. Famous English guitarist Julian Bream is accompanied by Alla Rakha playing the Tabla and Ali Akbar Khan, a virtuoso of the Indian sarod - a four stringed instrument similar to the lute. Note: ‘East West Encounter’ appears at the end of the film.

group_siblings.title: The Class
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Huw Wheldon and BBC-TV

results.title: The Class
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Huw Wheldon and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Monitor”.
A close-up of the work of a class in a drama school and of the methods used to train the aspiring actors and actresses. John Schlesinger’s command of the particular directing technique required is such that the film appears to have been made spontaneously during the forty minutes or so of the single class. In fact it needed a week’s shooting and a considerable amount of preparation in order to give this impression. The tutor (Harold Lang) uses the Mercy Speech from ‘The Merchant of Venice’ as a starting point in an improvisation by the students. Originally made for the BBC Television program ‘Monitor’, it is exciting to watch a production in the hands of a dedicated artist.
